flawed_nl_solution:
Matthew picked 16 + 20 = <<16+20=36>>36 strawberries.
Natalie picked 36/2 = <<36/2=81.0>>81.0 strawberries.
All together, they have 16 + 36 + 81.0 = <<16+36+81.0=133.0>>133.0 strawberries.
They can make 133.0/7 = <<133.0/7=19.0>>19.0 jars of strawberries.
They earn 19.0 x $4 = $<<19.0*4=76.0>>76.0 from the strawberries they picked.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 18.0, not 81.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
